key_title: Key to the species of Lachnagrostis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

leads.lead_text: Glumes with finely scabrous lateral surfaces, marginal cilia and strongly scabrous keels ending in setae at least 0.7 mm long
Glumes either smooth or lacking marginal cilia, but never with apical setae as long as 0.7 mm
Awn well-developed, geniculate, inserted about halfway along lemma back; mature panicle spreading above but with strongly deflexed lower branches; florets fertile

Awn reduced to a weak straight or curved (not geniculate) bristle, inserted about two-thirds (from base) along lemma  back; mature panicle with contracted to somewhat spreading primary branches but appressed secondary and tertiary branchlets.
Lemma awn inserted within one-quarter lemma length from base; fresh leaves tightly folded
Lemma awn inserted above one-quarter lemma length from base; fresh leaves flat or involute
Lemma awn well developed and strongly geniculate
Lemma awnless or awn variously reduced to a minute point or a straight to curved or weakly geniculate bristle
Lemma without hairs
Lemma with hairs
Lemma strongly scaberulous in upper half; fresh leaves involute
Lemma smooth or very finely scaberulous in upper half; fresh leaves flat
Inflorescence remaining green or sometimes with a purplish cast/flecking but never distinctly purple, sometimes becoming divaricate/spreading in late maturity
Inflorescence distinctly purple or becoming so with maturity, soon divaricate/spreading
Spikelets mostly > 4 mm long; anthers > 0.6 mm long; fresh leaves flat
Spikelets mostly < 4 mm long; anthers < 0.6 mm long or less; fresh leaves involute
Lemma covered in hairs
Lemma not covered in hairs, but sparse, scattered hairs may be present
Inflorescence strongly purple; culms > 50 cm high (SW Vic.)
Inflorescence green or purplish; culms < 50 cm high (montane spp.)
Fresh leaf blades involute; mostly in saline to subsaline depressions on the volcanic plain west of Melbourne
Fresh leaf blades flat; mosty in damp (freshwater) sites in forest or shrubland usually near the coast
Awn absent, or if present, to 1.8 mm long
Awn always present, 2–2.5 mm long
